data.title: Library Research Portal
data.text:
Academic Search Complete, from EBSCOhost, is a scholarly, multi-disciplinary database, with more than 8,500 full-text periodicals, including more than 7,300 peer-reviewed journals. In addition to full-text, this database offers indexing and abstracts for more than 12,500 journals and a total of more than 13,200 publications, including monographs, reports, conference proceedings, etc. Searchable cited references are provided for more than 1,400 journals.

The peer-reviewed electronic books of the American Chemical Society (ACS) contain research by the world's leading chemical scientists spanning all disciplines and applications. The eBooks consist of the ACS Symposium Series and the Advances in Chemistry series.

The American Chemical Society (ACS) journals cover multidisciplinary research at the interface of chemistry and other fields, with content that is relevant to a range of disciplines. The collection includes articles from the most-cited journals in chemistry and beyond, including the work of 180 Nobel Laureates.

Aerospace Research Central (ARC) is the platform for AIAA (American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics) electronic content covering topics in aerospace engineering, science, and technology. The AIAA resources document the most important developments and the latest research in aerospace for engineering professionals and related fields.

Aerospace Research Central (ARC), from the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA), provides access to selected electronic book titles in the AIAA Education Series, Library of Flight, and Progress in Astronautics and Aeronautics collections.

AIP Publishing, from the American Institute of Physics (AIP), provides a portfolio of peer-reviewed journals presenting scholarly publications in the fields of the physical and related sciences, including the flagship journals Applied Physics Letters, Journal of Applied Physics, and The Journal of Chemical Physics, in addition to the AIP Conference Proceedings.

APS publications, from the American Physical Society (APS), serve the international physics community with peer-reviewed research journals, news and commentary about the latest research published in the Physical Review journals, news about and for members, and information about physics and its place in the world.

The ASCE Library, from the American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE), provides access to a high-quality collection of civil engineering content. It provides access to full-text papers from ASCE journals, papers from conference proceedings, and electronic books and standards.

ASM Handbooks Online, from ASM International (formerly the American Society for Metals), features the complete content of thirty ASM Handbook volumes, several ASM Handbook supplements, and two ASM Desk Editions.

The ASME Digital Collection, from the American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME), is a repository of current and archival conference proceedings from ASME in the field of mechanical engineering and allied disciplines.

The ASME Digital Collection, from the American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME), is a repository of current and archival, peer-reviewed and professionally curated transaction journals from ASME in the field of mechanical engineering that includes the history of mechanical engineering research as well as cutting-edge discoveries being made today.

ASTM Compass, from ASTIM International (formerly the American Society for Testing and Materials), is a database of materials standards and technical engineering information. The electronic library covers a broad range of engineering disciplines, with a focus on testing and evaluation literature. Additionally, ASTM Compass provides access to all of the ASTM journals, manuals, and Special Technical Publications.

Aviation Week & Space Technology, often abbreviated Aviation Week or AW&ST, is the flagship magazine of the Aviation Week Network. The weekly magazine reports on the aerospace, defense, and aviation industries, with a core focus on aerospace technology. It has a reputation for its contacts inside the United States military and industry organizations.

The Aviation Week Intelligence Network (AWIN) provides access to five Aviation Week publications: Aviation Week & Space Technology, Inside MRO, Aerospace Daily & Defense Report, and ShowNews. In addition, the World Aerospace Database provides information on organizations, personnel, products and services, and program suppliers, and the subscription allows access to the Military Fleet subset of the Fleet Data product.

AVS: Science & Technology of Materials, Interfaces, and Processing (formerly the American Vacuum Society). As an interdisciplinary, professional society, AVS supports networking among academic, industrial, government, and consulting professionals involved in a variety of disciplines - chemistry, physics, biology, mathematics, all engineering disciplines, business, sales, etc. through common interests related to the basic science, technology development, and commercialization of materials, interfaces, and processing area.

The BIOSIS Citation Index (1983-present) is an expansive index to life sciences and biomedical research covering pre-clinical and experimental research, methods and instrumentation, animal studies, and more. Accessible via the Web of Science platform.

Business Source Ultimate, from EBSCOhost, offers peer-reviewed, full-text journals and other resources that provide historical information and current trends in business to assist with research on future developments and changes in the business world.

The Aerospace and High Performance Alloys Database (AHAD), from CINDAS LLC, contains materials properties data on 298 alloys, with nearly 100,000 data curves and 19,329 pages. Like other CINDAS databases, it is updated and expanded continually with carefully selected alloys.

The Damage Tolerant Design Handbook (DTDH), from CINDAS LLC, is a comprehensive compilation of fracture and crack growth data for high strength alloys. The handbook is a compilation of mechanical property data that are useful for damage tolerant design and analyses. Each alloy section contains a data summary, fracture toughness data, and crack growth resistance data.

The Microelectronics Packaging Materials Database (MPMD), from CINDAS LLC, contains data and information on thermal, mechanical, electrical and physical properties of electronics packaging materials; the database is continually updated and expanded. The MPMD contains 1,080 materials, 405 properties, and contains approximately 23,450 data curves.

The Structural Alloys Handbook (SAH), from CINDAS LLC, originated to assist designers in the metals and alloys selection process, draws on a database of well-defined test results and metals properties information. It includes representative, detailed characterization data for the more common metals and alloys important to construction, machine tool, heavy equipment, automotive, and general manufacturing industries.

The Thermophysical Properties of Matter Database (TPMD), from CINDAS LLC, contains data and information on thermophysical properties. This is the searchable, electronic version of the Thermophysical Properties of Matter, the TPRC data series; the database is continually updated and expanded. The TPMD contains over 5,000 materials categorized into 85 material groups, 107 properties, and over 51,700 data curves.

The Data Citation Index (1983-present) allows users to discover research data sets and data studies from a wide range of international data repositories in the sciences, social sciences, and arts and humanities. Accessible via the Web of Science platform.

The Derwent Innovations Index (1983-present) combines unique value-added patent information indexed from over 50 patent issuing authorities in the Derwent World Patent Index (1963-present) with patent citations indexed from the Derwent Patents Citation Index (1973-present). Accessible via the Web of Science platform.

The Defense Technical Information Center (DTIC) is the repository for research and engineering information for the U.S. Department of Defense. DTIC's services are available to DoD personnel, federal government personnel, federal contractors, and selected academic institutions. The general public can access unclassified information through the public website.

The eBook Collection, from EBSCOhost, provides the ability to search and view the full-text of electronic books. EBSCO's eBook Collection contains a variety of books, such as reference works, scientific monographs, literature and fiction.

The ECS Digital Library (DL) is home to the Journal of The Electrochemical Society (JES), the flagship journal of The Electrochemical Society. Additional peer-reviewed journals available via the ECS Digital Library include the ECS Journal of Solid State Science and Technology (JSS), ECS Electrochemistry Letters (EEL), and ECS Solid State Letters (SSL). In addition, the ECS Transactions (which include proceedings of ECS and ECS-sponsored symposia from meetings) can be accessed in the ECS Digital Library.

The selective list presented in the Fiction Core Collection, from EBSCOhost, features classic and contemporary works of fiction recommended for a general adult audience, written in or translated into English. The best authors and their most widely-read works in literary and popular fiction - old and new - are listed, including mysteries, science fiction, fantasy, Westerns and romance.

GeoRef, from the American Geosciences Institute (AGI), covers abstracts from journals, books, maps, conference papers, the U.S. Geological Survey, and more. Accessible via the Engineering Village platform.

Google Patents is a search engine that allows users to search through millions of patents and patent applications from over a dozen patent offices, including the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and those of other countries.

Google Scholar is a freely accessible web search engine that indexes the full-text or metadata of scholarly literature across an array of publishing formats and disciplines. (Users must sign-in via the library's proxy service to link directly to full-text resources.)

GreenFILE, from EBSCOhost, offers information covering all aspects of human impact to the environment. Its collection of scholarly, government and general-interest titles includes content on global warming, green building, pollution, sustainable agriculture, renewable energy, recycling, and more. The database provides indexing and abstracts for more than 384,000 records, as well as Open Access full text for more than 4,700 records.

Harvard Business Publishing, from EBSCOhost, provides access to over 600 full-text electronic book titles, both full books and chapters, covering the practice of management and other business-related topics.

The Harvard Business Review is written for upper-level management. It presents analysis of management problems and helpful commentary on advanced thinking and practice in all fields of management, administration, and strategic planning.

The IEEE Xplore Digital Library, from the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE), provides access to full-text peer-reviewed journals, transactions, magazines, conference proceedings, and published standards in the areas of electrical engineering, computer science, and electronics.

The IEEE Xplore Digital Library, from the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE), provides access to electronic book titles in the IEEE-Wiley, MIT Press, and Morgan & Claypool collections.
